intro: Pternandra simplex, commonly known as the white sand tree, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that resemble a bird's wings. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or inland rainforest habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
